paragraphs.text: If je ne suis pas Charlie, am I a bad person? Nuance gets lost in groupthink.
paragraphs.label: title

paragraphs.text: In the wake of terrorist attacks in Paris last week, many people in France and elsewhere have declared, Je suis Charlie
paragraphs.label: anecdote

paragraphs.text: ("I am Charlie")
paragraphs.label: no-unit

paragraphs.text: after heavily armed gunmen broke into the headquarters of Charlie Hebdo, a satirical French magazine, and killed eight staff members, two police officers, a building maintenance worker and wounded several others
paragraphs.label: anecdote

paragraphs.text: On Sunday, hundreds of thousands of people including a number of world leaders such as Angela Merkel, Benjamin Netanyahu, and David Cameron gathered in Paris for a unity rally, to stand in mourning, in defiance
paragraphs.label: anecdote

paragraphs.text: There were cries of Je suis Charlie, Je suis Ahmed(I am Ahmed, the Muslim police officer who lost his life in the attack), Je suis juif(I am a Jew)
paragraphs.label: anecdote

paragraphs.text: These declarations were a display of solidarity with those who lost their lives and those who survived
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: They allowed people to try and place themselves in the lives of others by using the power of language
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: We have seen this kind of remembrance before in the face of tragedy
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: I am Troy Davis
paragraphs.label: anecdote

paragraphs.text: I am Mike Brown
paragraphs.label: anecdote

paragraphs.text: I am Eric Garner
paragraphs.label: anecdote

paragraphs.text: I am Renisha McBride
paragraphs.label: anecdote

paragraphs.text: But we are none of these people
paragraphs.label: common-ground

paragraphs.text: We can and do empathize with the plights of the dead, the survivors and their loved ones
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: We can and do empathize with how fragile we all are, and with how we cannot be ruled by terror, but
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: why the rhetorical urge to take the place of the fallen?
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: What does it bring them?
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: I, too, have ached since hearing the news of what happened in Paris but je ne suis pas Charlie et je ne suis pas Ahmed et je ne suis pas juif
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: There are times when silence equals consent, but is the loss of someone else's life really such an instance?
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: Is it reasonable to assume that if je ne suis pas Charlie, I tacitly endorse terrorism?
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: I believe in the freedom of expression, unequivocally
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: though
paragraphs.label: no-unit

paragraphs.text: as
paragraphs.label: no-unit

paragraphs.text: I have written before
paragraphs.label: no-unit

paragraphs.text: I wish more people would understand that freedom of expression is not freedom from consequence
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: I find some of the work of Charlie Hebdo distasteful
paragraphs.label: anecdote

paragraphs.text: because there is a preponderance of bigotry of all kinds in many of their cartoons' sentiments
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: Still
paragraphs.label: no-unit

paragraphs.text: my distaste should not dictate the work the magazine produces or anything else
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: The cartoonists at Charlie Hebdo - and writers and artists everywhere - should be able to express themselves and challenge authority without being murdered
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: Murder is not an acceptable consequence for anything
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: Yet it is also an exercise of freedom of expression to express offense at the way satire like Charlie Hebdo's characterizes something you hold dear - like your faith, your personhood, your gender, your sexuality, your race or ethnicity
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: Demands for solidarity can quickly turn into demands for groupthink
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: making it difficult to express nuance
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: It puts the terms of our understanding of the situation in black and white
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: you are either with us or against us - instead of allowing people to mourn and be angry while also being sympathetic to complexities that are being overlooked
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: It has been disheartening to see calls for the Muslim community to denounce terrorism
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: It has been disheartening to see journalists highlighting the stories of "good" Muslims
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: as if
paragraphs.label: no-unit

paragraphs.text: goodness is the exception to the rule of an entire people
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: We will continue to see discussions of satire, the freedom of expression and its limits
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: We will see speculations as to how such a tragedy can be avoided
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: because it is easier to speculate than it is to accept that we cannot prevent terrorism
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: We cannot sway extremists with rational thought or with our ideas of right and wrong
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: Life moves quickly
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: but
paragraphs.label: no-unit

paragraphs.text: sometimes, consideration does not
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: And yet
paragraphs.label: no-unit

paragraphs.text: we insist that people provide an immediate response, or immediate agreement, a universal, immediate me-too
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: as though we don't want people to pause at all, to consider what they are weighing in on
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: We don't want to complicate our sorrow or outrage
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: when
paragraphs.label: no-unit

paragraphs.text: it is easier to experience these emotions in their simplest, purest states
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: The older(and hopefully wiser) I get, the more I want to pause
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: I want to take the time to think through how I feel and why I feel
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: I don't want to feign expertise on matters I know nothing about for the purpose of offering someone else my immediate reaction for their consumption
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: The demand for response from all of us through the means available to us, most often our social networks, rises in part because we can feel so impotent in our day-to-day lives
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: We are people with jobs and families and our quotidian concerns
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: It is easy to feel impotent in the face of terrorism in Paris or hundreds of girls being kidnapped in Nigeria or a bombing at an NAACP building in Colorado or an unarmed black man being killed by a police officer
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: Within our social networks, we can feel less alone
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: We can feel less impotent
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: We can make these gestures of solidarity
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: Je suis Charlie
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: We can change our avatars
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: We can share our anger, our fear, or devastation without having to face that we may not be able to do much more
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: But
paragraphs.label: no-unit

paragraphs.text: we still feel impotent
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: and
paragraphs.label: no-unit

paragraphs.text: we still feel inadequate
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: When we see people not participating in our expressions of solidarity-- not showing their awareness of their own impotence-- we see something we can possibly change
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: That is why we demand allegiance
paragraphs.label: assumption
